top_categories.workout_context: Ruby Roubaix rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Ruby Roubaix when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Ruby Roubaix’s ruby mountains gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Ruby Roubaix. Make this intensity feel like home.
Ruby Roubaix’s mountain gravel, high desert demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Ruby Roubaix’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Racing Ruby Roubaix isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Every session at Ruby Roubaix intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Ruby Roubaix’s ruby mountains gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Ruby Roubaix’s 5,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Ruby Roubaix — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Ruby Roubaix — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Ruby Roubaix’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Ruby Roubaix with 5,000ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. High altitude (6000-8000+ feet); Sun exposure at altitude.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Ruby Roubaix requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on ruby mountains gravel to build confidence. Expect: mountain gravel, high desert, ruby mountains.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and VO2max to prepare you for 62 miles of ruby mountains gravel in Lamoille, Nevada.
